org.modelio.api.module.report

Class ReportDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.platform.ui.dialog.ModelioDialog
      • org.modelio.api.ui.ModelioDialog
        • org.modelio.api.module.report.ReportDialog

  • public class ReportDialog
extends ModelioDialog
    The report dialog is used by modules willing to display the contents of a Report which they have built during a processing operation by adding ReportEntry records to it. A Report is a sequence of ReportEntry. A ReportEntry can be of several kind (see @link EntryKind. The contents of the report are displayed in HTML rendered text in a browser. Two kind of links are exclusively supported:
    • modelio model element links that allow to navigate to a given element listed in the report
    • modelio help topic links that pops the Modelio help for a given topic.
    The ReportDialog browser is configured to ignore any other type of link. The @link HTMLReport private class is in charge to lay out the reported message in HTML text, controlled by its internal CSS stylesheet HTMLReport#CSS.

    Typical use: 

     Report myReport = new Report();
 myReport.addError(...);
 myReport.addWarning(...);
 myReport.addTip(...);
 myReport.addInfo(...);
 
 ReportDialog dlg = new ReportDialog(parent, navigationService, modelioHelpService, myReport);
 dlg.open();

    Since:
    4.1

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReportDialog

        public ReportDialog(Shell parentShell,
                    IModelingSession session,
                    INavigationService navigationService,
                    Report report)
        C'tor
        Parameters:
        parentShell - the parent shell. Can be null.
        session - access to the project's model. Can be null in which case element links are not displayed and no navigation is possible..
        navigationService - the Modelio navigation service. Can be null in which case element links are not displayed and no navigation is possible.
        report - the report to display. Cannot be null.
